thread.title: SEC Football by the Numbers: Where does Steve Spurrier rank among the conference's coaches?
thread.title_full: SEC Football by the Numbers: Where does Steve Spurrier rank among the conference's coaches?

author: Mark Inabinett | minabinett@al.com
title: SEC Football by the Numbers: Where does Steve Spurrier rank among the conference's coaches?
text:
Share Steve Spurrier and the SEC’s greatest coaches 
Steve Spurrier’s resignation at South Carolina ends a quarter-century career as a coach in the SEC. Already among the conference’s greatest players as the 1966 Heisman Trophy winner while playing at Florida, where does he rank among the SEC’s coaches? Here are the top 10 coaches in league history based on total victories achieved in games played when their teams were members of the SEC: 1. Paul “Bear” Bryant: 292 victories 
Coaching at Kentucky from 1946 through 1953 and Alabama from 1958 through 1982, Bryant compiled a record of 292-69-14. His teams won or shared 14 league titles. 2. Steve Spurrier: 208 victories 
Coaching at Florida from 1990 through 2001 and South Carolina from 2005 through 2015, Spurrier compiled a record of 208-76-1. His teams won six league titles. 3. Vince Dooley: 201 victories 
Coaching at Georgia from 1964 through 1988, Dooley compiled a record of 201-77-10. His teams won or shared six league titles. 4. Johnny Vaught: 190 victories 
Coaching at Ole Miss from 1947 through 1970 and in the 1973 season, Vaught compiled a record of 190-60-12. His teams won or shared six league titles. 5. Ralph “Shug” Jordan: 176 victories 
Coaching at Auburn from 1951 through 1975, Jordan compiled a record of 176-83-6. His teams won one league title. 6. Phillip Fulmer: 152 victories 
Coaching at Tennessee from 1992 through 2008, Fulmer compiled a record of 152-52. His teams won two league titles. 7. Nick Saban: 144 victories 
Coaching at LSU from 2000 through 2004 and Alabama from 2007 through 2015, Saban has compiled a 144-34 record. His teams have won five league titles. 8. Bobby Dodd: 142 victories 
Coaching at Georgia Tech from 1945 through 1963, Dodd compiled a 142-56-7 record. His teams won two league titles. Dodd coached at Georgia Tech through the 1966 season, but the Yellow Jackets left the SEC after the 1963 season. 9. Wally Butts: 140 victories 
Coaching at Georgia from 1939 through 1960, Butts compiled a 140-86-9 record. His teams won or shared four league titles. 10. Mark Richt: 140 victories 
Coaching at Georgia from 2001 through 2015, Richt has compiled a record of 140-50. His teams have won two league titles. Conference victories 
The list of coaches with the most SEC victories – that is, regular-season conference games won – contains the same 10 names as the top 10 in overall victories, with the order changed slightly. The top 10 in league victories are Bear Bryant 159, Steve Spurrier 126, Johnny Vaught 106, Vince Dooley 105, Shug Jordan 97, Phillip Fulmer 95, Nick Saban 83, Bobby Dodd 82, Mark Richt 80 and Wally Butts 67. Winning percentage 
The 10 coaches with the best winning percentage in games when their teams were SEC members differ from the total-victories list. Urban Meyer’s .813 winning percentage at Florida is No. 1 among coaches with at least five seasons in the SEC, followed by Alabama’s Gene Stallings .810, Nick Saban .809, Alabama’s Frank Thomas .805, Bear Bryant .797, LSU’s Les Miles .790, Tennessee’s Robert Neyland .780, Mississippi State’s Allyn McKeen .764, Johnny Vaught .749 and Phillip Fulmer .743. Spurrier is 12 th on this list at .732. Conference winning percentage 
Ranking the SEC coaches by their conference winning percentage (based on on-the-field, won-lost records in regular-season league games) yields another top 10 for coaches with at least five SEC seasons. Gene Stallings is on top at .791, followed by Robert Neyland .787, Nick Saban .776, Frank Thomas .765, Bear Bryant .764, Urban Meyer .750, Phillip Fulmer .735, Vince Dooley .713, Les Miles .711 and Steve Spurrier .709. ‹ › Comment on "SEC Football by the Numbers: Where does Steve Spurrier rank among the conference's coaches?"
